title: Stock Futures Rise on Tech Earnings, Dollar Steady: Markets Wrap
summary: US equity-index futures climbed as strong earnings from megacap tech firms bolstered optimism that corporate profits remain resilient. The dollar steadied after gaining on the Federal Reserve’s decision to hold interest rates.
fullContent: US equity-index futures climbed as strong earnings from megacap tech firms bolstered optimism that corporate profits remain resilient. The dollar steadied after gaining on the Federal Reserve’s decision to hold interest rates.

title: US Stock Futures Advance on Tech, Yen Gains on BOJ: Markets Wrap
summary: US equity-index futures climbed after strong earnings from megacap tech firms reinforced optimism around resilient corporate profits. The yen held gains against the dollar as the Bank of Japan left interest rates unchanged.
fullContent: US equity-index futures climbed after strong earnings from megacap tech firms reinforced optimism around resilient corporate profits. The yen held gains against the dollar as the Bank of Japan left interest rates unchanged.

title: Stock Futures Rise on Tech Earnings, Dollar Falls: Markets Wrap
summary: Stocks looked set to rise in the US and Europe as upbeat earnings from megacap technology companies bolstered optimism over resilient corporate profits. The dollar gave up some gains made after the Federal Reserve held benchmark interest rates.
fullContent: Stocks looked set to rise in the US and Europe as upbeat earnings from megacap technology companies bolstered optimism over resilient corporate profits. The dollar gave up some gains made after the Federal Reserve held benchmark interest rates.

title: Nasdaq Futures Rally as Big Tech Earnings Deliver: Markets Wrap

title: Stocks, Bonds Hold Gains After US Inflation Data: Markets Wrap
summary: A rally in big tech drove stocks higher, with the market holding gains after the latest inflation and spending data illustrated the tug and pull that has Federal Reserve officials split over the course of monetary policy. Bond yields fell and the dollar wavered.

title: Stocks Pare Gains on Jobs Eve as Mexico Peso Jumps: Markets Wrap
summary: A tech-driven stock bounce eased on the eve of a key jobs report, following data that showed stubborn inflation and weaker-than-expected personal spending. Bond yields fell. The Mexican peso jumped as President Donald Trump said he extended current tariff rates for 90 days.
fullContent: A tech-driven stock bounce eased on the eve of a key jobs report, following data that showed stubborn inflation and weaker-than-expected personal spending. Bond yields fell. The Mexican peso jumped as President Donald Trump said he extended current tariff rates for 90 days.

title: Fed Holds Interest Rates Steady | Bloomberg Surveillance: The Fed Decides 7/30/2025
summary: Jon Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Tom Keene host a special edition of "Bloomberg Surveillance" covering Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell's remarks. Powell says interest rates are in the right place to manage continued uncertainty around tariffs and inflation, tempering...
fullContent: Jon Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Tom Keene host a special edition of "Bloomberg Surveillance" covering Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell's remarks. Powell says interest rates are in the right place to manage continued uncertainty around tariffs and inflation, tempering expectations for a rate cut in September. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Meta Gives Strong Third-Quarter Sales Forecast, Sees Higher 2025 CapEx On AI Spending
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. topped projections for second-quarter sales and gave a stronger-than-expected forecast for the current period, a sign that the social media company’s advertising business is still growing quickly enough to support aggressive spending on artificial...
fullContent: Meta Platforms Inc. topped projections for second-quarter sales and gave a stronger-than-expected forecast for the current period, a sign that the social media company’s advertising business is still growing quickly enough to support aggressive spending on artificial intelligence. Meta lifted the low end of its forecast for 2025 capital expenditures as it continues to invest heavily in the talent, infrastructure, data centers and energy needed to compete in a fast-moving AI race. The company now expects to spend $66 billion to $72 billion this year. The projection was adjusted higher in April to account for ongoing trade disputes and AI investments. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow and Kurt Wagner join Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: White House Seeks ‘Swift Confirmation’ of Brian Quintenz for CFTC
summary: The White House reiterated support for President Donald Trump’s pick to lead Wall Street’s main derivatives regulator after a delay in confirming him sparked speculation about his candidacy.
fullContent: Brian Quintenz, chair of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) nominee for US President Donald Trump, is sworn in during a Senate Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry Committee confirmation hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, June 10, 2025. If confirmed, Quintenz would be heading an agency with two major policy initiatives that are intertwined with his financial and professional interests: digital assets and event contracts.

title: Microsoft CFO calls for 'intensity' in an internal memo, after blowout earnings
summary: Microsoft reported a $27 billion quarterly profit, after cutting thousands of jobs. The CFO is keeping up the pressure.
fullContent: Amy Hood, chief financial officer at Microsoft.Stephen Brashear/Getty ImagesMicrosoft's top finance executive sent an internal email to workers calling for "intensity" in 2026.Last week, another memo from the CEO attempted to explain big job cuts in the midst of huge profit.On Wednesday, Microsoft reported a quarterly profit of $27 billion.Microsoft employees should strap in for another year of "intensity," according to the software giant's top finance executive.Chief Financial Officer Amy Hood sent an email to employees on Wednesday after the company reported a $27 billion quarterly profit, telling them the year ahead will require "intensity, clarity, and bold execution."Hood sends out these emails every quarter when Microsoft discloses its financials. Her missives mostly rehash what the company reports publicly, such as how revenue and profit are growing.Sometimes, though, Hood's emails provide insight into what the company's top executives deem most important and what they want empl

title: Brazil Holds Interest Rate at 15% on High Inflation, Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Brazil’s central bank kept its interest rate steady and said it will remain on hold for the foreseeable future as policymakers stay vigilant on above-target inflation and uncertainty caused by Donald Trump’s tariffs.
fullContent: A pedestrians walks past the Central Bank of Brazil headquarters in Brasilia, Brazil, on Tuesday, June 18, 2024. In Brazil, the central bank on Wednesday may well draw the line under its 325 basis-point easing cycle and keep the benchmark Selic at 10.5% amid unmoored inflation expectations and mounting government spending concerns.

title: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
Facebook Parent Meta Tops Earnings Estimates With Revenue Forecast of $47 Billion
summary: Meta’s third-quarter earnings topped estimates. The tech giant posted beats across the board for 2Q from revenues to EPS and operating income. For the third quarter, Meta sees revenues of $47.5 billion to $50.
fullContent: Meta’s third-quarter earnings topped estimates. The tech giant posted beats across the board for 2Q from revenues to EPS and operating income. For the third quarter, Meta sees revenues of $47.5 billion to $50.5 billion which is a fair bit above consensus at midpoint of the range. Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities, global head of technology research, and Bloomberg Intelligence’s Mandeep Singh break down the earnings. -------- Watch Bloomberg Radio LIVE on YouTube Weekdays 7am-6pm ET WATCH HERE: http://bit.ly/3vTiACF Follow us on X: https://twitter.com/BloombergRadio Subscribe to our Podcasts: Bloomberg Daybreak: http://bit.ly/3DWYoAN Bloomberg Surveillance: http://bit.ly/3OPtReI Bloomberg Intelligence: http://bit.ly/3YrBfOi Balance of Power: http://bit.ly/3OO8eLC Bloomberg Businessweek: http://bit.ly/3IPl60i Listen on Apple CarPlay and Android Auto with the Bloomberg Business app: Apple CarPlay: https://apple.co/486mghI Android Auto: https://bit.ly/49benZy Visit our YouTube channels: Bloombe

Ford CEO on Earnings, EV Offerings, Tariffs
summary: Ford Motor Co. says profits will fall as much as 36% this year due to President Donald Trump's tariffs. Ford CEO Jim Farley talks about that, earnings, electric vehicles and expanding its hybrid lineup. Earnings of 37 cents a share did beat Wall Street estimates.
fullContent: Ford Motor Co. says profits will fall as much as 36% this year due to President Donald Trump's tariffs.
